body.name: ViewSonic VX4381-4K 43 Inch Ultra HD MVA 4K Monitor Widescreen with HDR10 Support, Eye Care, HDMI, USB, DisplayPort for Home and Office, Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 2 hrs 10 mins
features: VERSATILE MONITOR: 43 Inch 4K UHD (3840x2160p) MVA monitor with thin bezels and 60Hz refresh rate
MULTIPICTURE FUNCTIONALITY: Supports multi tasking and simultaneous viewing of up to 4 video sources at Full HD 1080p resolution
HDR10 CONTENT SUPPORT: For deep contrast, rich color, and vibrant details
ENHANCED VIEWING COMFORT: Flicker Free technology and Blue Light Filter for reduced eye fatigue
FLEXIBLE CONNECTIVITY: The VX4381 4K supports laptops, PCs, and Macs with HDMI, USB, DisplayPort, and Mini DisplayPort inputs
body.description: Designed with productivity in mind, the ViewSonic® VX4381-4K combines incredible 4K resolution, a sleek narrow-bezel design, and an expansive 43” (42.5" viewable) screen so you can see all and do all from a single monitor. Featuring an MVA panel and 3840x2160 resolution, this monitor offers best-in-class screen performance with incredibly sharp and detailed visuals, while HDR10 content support delivers a high dynamic range of vivid color and contrast. Flexible and versatile for any office application ranging from document editing to graphic design, the VX4381-4K includes connectivity options such as DisplayPort 1.4, mini DisplayPort 1.4, DisplayPort Out, HDMI 2.0, and 3-USB ports. ViewSonic’s MultiPicture™ functionality allows for efficient multitasking by providing simultaneous viewing of up to four split windows, while full ergonomic functionality delivers maximum comfort and enhanced productivity. With an energy-saving Eco-mode feature and ViewSonic’s industry-leading 3-year limited warranty, this monitor is a solid long-term investment, delivering great power savings while boosting productivity for a variety of business applications.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: VX4381-4K More Screen. More Applications. ViewSonic VX Large Screen Monitors

Stunning 4K Ultra HD Resolution With more than 8 million pixels and 4X the resolution of a Full HD monitor, this Ultra HD 3840x2160 monitor positions every pixel perfectly for breathtaking clarity. Do More With One Screen With multi-window viewing, users can achieve more productivity with one display. MVA Panel Technology With MVA technology, this monitor delivers consistent, accurate images no matter which angle you’re looking at the screen. Dual Integrated Speakers With dual integrated speakers, this monitor combines incredible screen performance with immersive stereo sound for a delightful audiovisual experience.

Previous page Versatile Connectivity HDMI, USB, DisplayPort and Mini DisplayPort give you the freedom to connect to a variety of devices. Optimized View Settings ViewSonic’s unique ViewMode feature offers ‘Game,’ ‘Movie,’ ‘Web,’ ‘Text,’ and ‘Mono’ presets. Next page 1 Versatile Connectivity 2 Optimized View Settings

Previous page Eye Care Flicker-Free and Blue Light technology help reduce eye strain over extended periods. VESA Compatible Mount Easily install your monitor on a VESA-compatible wall mount or stand. HDR10 Content Support Experience an enhanced viewing experience and jaw-dropping colors with HDR support. Next page 1 Eye Care 2 VESA Compatible Mount 3 HDR10 Content Support

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding for Work
reviews.reviewText: I’m a software engineer and I work for about 10-11 hours per day. I had a curved screen which I liked, but I wanted something larger. I work with Office and PDF documents quite a bit and require crystal clear text on my screen. This turned out to be perfect!Excellent viewing of text, small and large, video conferencing calls are clear and picture perfect, as is various edit tools and the Adobe Suite of apps. I couldn’t be happier and the excellent service from Amazon made getting it easy. It’s: I am not a gamer so have no comments on that. I use this with my work MacBook Pro laptops

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good quality for productivity overall. Went from 27 inch 12 year old ViewSonic, to this 43 inch, also ViewSonic, so you know i am loyal. Massive real estate for productivity. Online games are ok, even without a discrete graphics cards (I use a 12th Gen Intel CPU). No dead pixels, and brightness is good. There is motion blur when moving windows around, but that is expected from a VA panel. I recommend it for productivity. Got a second one on sale to replace wife's 27 inch Viewsonic too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars VX4381-4k unuseable in perfect condition
reviews.reviewText: The display on this monitor is near to illegible for reading text, the pixels fuzzy, not sharp, absolutely worthless for desktop publishing. The display was received in excellent condition. It also did not support the HDMI input off a 2012 Mac well, the display being squished horizontally, but it was fine for a 2018 Mac. I had to return this monitor to PC Nation. They did not pay for return shipping, so while they shipped the monitor for $50 on their corporate account, I had to ship UPS for $360, half the price of the monitor! An expensive mistake on my part. You've been warned.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Happy i took a chance.
reviews.reviewText: I originally was using a 14-ms response time sharp 43" 4k tv and after changing video cards from a GeForce 2070 to a 3060ti it had difficulties getting signal during restarts so after some research I decided to give this monitor a try. It was easy to set up outstanding picture quality and LOTS of real-estate for viewing. I am not a fps gamer but I enjoy coop, MMO games Ark, Atlas, Grounded, Fallout 76 and Space Engineers Great picture and under 4ms response time I am Beyond happy if you are looking for a large monitor this is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not for video, gaming and medicore image quality
reviews.reviewText: Took a gamble with buying this monitor because there were no decent (or not decent) test reviews for this particular model available online when I ordered it (Sep 2021). Suffice to say, this monitor is just acceptable, but not really great at anything.The major issue I have with this monitor is a very noticeable grid of diagonal lines, which briefly shows up whenever motion is involved. I've uploaded a pic for better description. This image was taken by recording a video while slowly moving a camera in front of the screen, and then extracting individual frames with ffmpeg.Motion means, e.g. the player character moves towards a structure in a game, motion in videos, and even when I look at a still image while changing my position. The grid 'overlay' pops up for just a split second, but the reoccurrence gets really annoying over time. Increasing screen distance improves things, but with ~ 40" (~1 m) I'm already sitting further away from my screen than most people. I've mounted the display on a monitor stand behind my desk, so I can flexibly increase the distance, but this of course defies the purpose of getting a lager screen in the first place. I wanted 4k resolution at 100% Windows 10 scaling, but would have to go up to 125% at a larger distance. That's exactly the scaling I've used with my old 32" 4k screen, so it looks like I've played myself.Some pros & cons:(+) The monitor is well-packed and protected by a humongous, large box.(+) The device comes fully assembled, including the heavy & sturdy stand.(+) All required, basic cables are included.(+) My individual 'copy' has no dead pixels, corner bleed, or other blemishes.(+) HDR in Windows 10 is supported without issues, using standard Windows PnP drivers.(+) Aside from the motion problem, still images and text look acceptable, and there are no other artifacts visible in games and videos @60Hz.(+) The screen has a DP out port, allowing to daisy-chain up to 4 monitors(-) The article description is misleading because this monitor can't do 75Hz @4k. According to the manual, 75 Hz is supported only at 2560x1600, 1920x1440, 1440x900, and a couple lower resolutions. I can't even confirm the latter because even with my iVANKY 8K DP Cable (4k@144Hz) and an RTX 3090, 75Hz is not available at any resolution.(-) Colors, especially in HDR, look washed out no matter the selected preset or manual adjustment.(-) Text at 100% scaling looks pixelated at the edges, although still acceptable. This gets better by switching to a dark theme.(-) The manual often only lists settings, without explaining them. So trial and error is unavoidable.(-) Monitor drivers, available online only, can't be installed due to error messages. The signed Windows 10 driver setup errors out by claiming the detected monitor isn't supported. Manual extraction revealed that the package indeed only includes drivers for the predecessor VX4380-4K (and older models), but not for this model, the VX4381-4K -.- For what it's worth, the VX4380-4K driver can be installed manually, but I didn't see any improvement over using the standard PnP drivers and reverted back. The unsigned Win 10 driver installer finally tops it off by wining that the operating system isn't supported -.- -.-(-) The joystick control for the OSD is terrible because the OSD often indicates different joystick directions for the same navigation.All things considered, I'm going to keep this monitor because it's technically without blemishes. Still waiting for a better solution, though. A few other options are available, sure, but they all have their issues, which made me stay clear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good big monitor
reviews.reviewText: Arrived on time, works as describedIt's big and the base for it it is much bigger than your standard monitor, so you do want to clear plenty of space for it. Picture quality is really good, good for watching videos or movies. Came with its own DisplayPort cable so I didn't have to buy one separately

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beast of a monitor.
reviews.reviewText: Top Notch. Should have purchased it before. Looks great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I found the display to not be as sharp as expected. The Sound Quality is poor and does not have a remote control to either turn it on or off and has no volume control independent of my computer's volume control. Listening to classical music such as piano playing is poor quality. It is worse than the Westinghouse TV 39" I was using. The Westinghouse had much better sharper images and much better sound quality, I am disappointed. I am a writer and needed a much larger display to allow reading the documents I am writing in MS Word. Again it has no remote control.

reviews.reviewTitle: Drivers do not come with the monitor
reviews.reviewText: This is initial review, until support will solve the issue.The instructions say to download drivers for the monitor from Viewsonic website. The downloaded file does not install. It is still a generic driver.The monitor blinks black every some time.I asked support for drivers file and they sent me the same instructions with executable, as I sent to them saying it does not work.It could be OK with someone, but they replied to a guy who works between system admin and accounting for the last 30 years.There are definitely just the drivers files for other models, even shown in the instructions they sent. But apparently they do not know what I am talking about.As I am busy, I will get back to it in July.
